excerpt: Landscaped park with gardens around a lake, with Japanese statues, pagoda and replica boat battles.
detail_description: Peasholm Park in Scarborough is a captivating oriental-themed park featuring Japanese statues, pagodas, and replica boat battles. It's a popular destination for leisurely strolls, picnics, and various activities like mini-golf and boating on the lake. The park boasts a rich history and has received accolades such as the Green Flag Award. Visitors can explore its picturesque gardens, bridges, streams, and waterfalls while enjoying open-air concerts at the bandstand.
name: Peasholm Park
address: N Bay Promenade, Scarborough, YO12 7TR, United Kingdom

excerpt: Medieval castle on site of ancient stronghold with coastal views, expansive grounds and live events.
detail_description: Scarborough Castle is a magnificent medieval fortress located on a rocky promontory in North Yorkshire, offering breathtaking views of the North Sea and the town of Scarborough. The castle has a rich history dating back to the Iron Age, with its earliest fortifications built in the 12th century. Its strategic location between the North Bay and South Bay made it an important defensive stronghold during historic wars. Today, visitors can explore its expansive grounds and attend live events while enjoying its stunning coastal vistas.
name: Scarborough Castle
address: Castle Rd, Scarborough, YO11 1HY, United Kingdom

excerpt: Grand Victorian building staging family entertainment, comedy nights, conferences and wedding fairs.
detail_description: The Scarborough Spa is a grand Victorian building located on the cliffs overlooking the beach, offering a variety of entertainment options for visitors. The complex includes the Grand Hall, which can accommodate large audiences, and the Spa Theatre with seating for over 600 people. In addition to these venues, there are several other spaces within the complex for different events and gatherings. Despite its historical appearance, the spa is equipped with modern facilities and is home to one of the last seaside orchestras in the country.
name: Scarborough Spa
address: South Bay, Scarborough, YO11 2HD, United Kingdom

excerpt: Iconic rotunda containing exhibits about local geology, archaeological relics and fossil finds.
detail_description: The Rotunda Museum, a historic landmark opened in 1829, is a treasure trove of coastal heritage and geology. It houses an impressive collection of archaeological relics, including finds from the renowned Mesolithic site at Star Carr. Visitors can marvel at dinosaur footprints and fossils while exploring exhibits that showcase Yorkshire's Dinosaur Coast. With over 5,500 fossils on display, this iconic rotunda offers a captivating journey through time, making it a must-visit for history enthusiasts.
name: Rotunda Museum: Museum of Coastal Heritage and Geology
address: Vernon Rd, Scarborough, YO11 2PS, United Kingdom

excerpt: Family-friendly exhibits with a variety of sea creatures (most offer play areas & group packages).
detail_description: SEA LIFE Scarborough is a family-friendly sanctuary featuring a variety of sea creatures, including penguins, otters, sharks, and seals. The highlight is the Seal Hospital where rescued seal pups are nursed back to health before being released into the wild. With 12 themed zones offering interactive rides and displays, visitors can learn about marine life conservation while having fun. The sanctuary also offers group packages and VIP experiences such as breakfast with the seals.
name: SEA LIFE Scarborough
address: Scalby Mills Rd, Scarborough, YO12 6RP, United Kingdom

excerpt: Seaside rides on a quaint train dating to 1931, plus a ropes course & a historic water chute.
detail_description: Scarborough North Bay Railway is a historic 20-inch gauge railway that has been in operation since 1931. The scenic route starts at Peasholm Park and winds through beautiful parkland, passing by Scarborough Open Air Theatre and North Bay before ending at Scalby Mills near the beaches and Sea Life Centre. Along the way, visitors can enjoy various family attractions such as a historic water chute, pedal boat hire, and Water Walkers.
name: Scarborough North Bay Railway
address: Burniston Rd, Scarborough, YO12 6PF, United Kingdom

excerpt: Gallery in a 19th-century Italianate villa offering rotating art exhibits & family activities.
detail_description: Scarborough Art Gallery, housed in a charming 19th-century Italianate villa, has been showcasing art since 1947. The gallery features a diverse collection of artworks, including both permanent and temporary exhibits from across the UK and around the world. Visitors can also enjoy a quaint cafe on-site. Additionally, the gallery often hosts temporary exhibitions with artwork from renowned artists. For those interested in history, the nearby Rotunda museum is worth exploring as well.
name: Scarborough Art Gallery
address: The Crescent, Scarborough, YO11 2PW, United Kingdom

detail_description: Scarborough Harbour is a historic and picturesque destination in North Yorkshire, offering a self-guided walking tour of its old town and waterfront. Established in the 13th century, the harbor is located between South Bay Beach and Marine Drive, providing level paved surfaces for easy exploration. Visitors can capture stunning photos of the colorful fishing boat fleet while enjoying fresh seafood from various eateries.
name: Scarborough Harbour
address: 1PE, Scarborough Borough Council H, 18 W Pier, Scarborough YO11 1PD, United Kingdom

excerpt: Well-known bands and opera in a vast 6000-capacity arena on an island in the middle of a lake.
detail_description: Scarborough Open Air Theatre is a historic 6000-capacity arena located on an island in the middle of a lake. It has hosted well-known bands, opera performances, and various entertainment events. The theatre underwent significant refurbishment in 2010 and was reopened by The Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh. Since then, it has welcomed renowned artists such as Elton John, Britney Spears, Noel Gallagher, Lionel Richie, Little Mix, and Lewis Capaldi.
name: Scarborough Open Air Theatre
address: Burniston Rd, Scarborough, YO12 6PF, United Kingdom

excerpt: Unassuming sandy beach with a kid-friendly vibe near casual eats, shops & attractions.
detail_description: South Bay Beach, located in Scarborough, offers a traditional English seaside experience with its sandy shores and family-friendly atmosphere. Situated near Scarborough Harbour and St. Nicholas Gardens, this bustling beach is surrounded by various attractions, dining options, and shops. It's known for its livelier ambiance compared to North Bay Beach and is popular among surfers due to its exposed position resulting in strong waves.
name: South Bay Beach
address: Scarborough, United Kingdom

excerpt: Scarborough is a resort town on England’s North Sea coast. Its 2 bays with sandy beaches are split by a headland bearing the 12th-century Scarborough Castle. The Victorian Central Tramway funicular train links the town centre with South Bay and its harbour. The Rotunda Museum explores local coastal geology. Scarborough SEA LIFE Sanctuary’s marine displays and the Peasholm Park Japanese gardens are behind North Bay.
detail_description: Scarborough, a charming resort town on England's North Sea coast, is known for its two sandy bays separated by the 12th-century Scarborough Castle. The Victorian Central Tramway funicular train connects the town center to South Bay and its harbor. Visitors can explore local coastal geology at the Rotunda Museum and enjoy marine displays at Scarborough SEA LIFE Sanctuary. Additionally, Peasholm Park offers Japanese gardens in North Bay.
name: Scarborough
address: United Kingdom

excerpt: Venue staging performing arts, new writing & revival productions in the round.
detail_description: The Stephen Joseph Theatre, situated near Scarborough's train station, is a cultural hub that showcases a variety of family-friendly performances, making it an ideal destination for entertaining outings during school holidays. The venue consists of two arenas - The Round and The McCarthy - offering different seating capacities and stage setups to accommodate various productions. Additionally, the theatre features Eat, a popular eatery within its premises, allowing visitors to enjoy a delightful meal before attending an afternoon show.
name: Stephen Joseph Theatre
address: Westborough, Scarborough, YO11 1JW, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Central Tramway in Scarborough is a historic funicular railway that has been operating since 1881. It runs along a 71-meter track with a steep 50% gradient, connecting Marine Parade near the town center to Foreshore Road on the beachfront. Unlike other funiculars in Britain, this one operates swiftly and efficiently without the need for tickets – passengers can simply pay at the tollbooth or use a contactless card.
name: Central Tramway
address: Upper Station, 1 Marine Parade, 2 St Nicholas Cliff, Scarborough YO11 2ER, United Kingdom

excerpt: 12th-century Anglican church & a large burial ground with the grave of English novelist Anne Brontë.
detail_description: St. Mary's Church in Scarborough is a stunning 12th-century Anglican church located near Scarborough Castle. The church has a rich history intertwined with the neighboring castle, as both were built around the same time and played roles in the English Civil War. The churchyard is home to Caedmon's cross and the grave of Anne Brontë, while also being associated with folklore and legends, including being mentioned in 'Dracula.' Despite suffering damage during the civil war, St.
name: St Mary's Church, Scarborough
address: St Mary's Church, Castle Rd, Scarborough YO11 1TH, United Kingdom

excerpt: Elegant landscaped gardens with a pond & statues, plus scenic views over South Bay & old town.
detail_description: The South Cliff Italian Gardens, located just south of the spa, offer an elegant and picturesque landscape with a pond, statues, and scenic views over South Bay and the old town. These gardens were designed in the Italian Renaissance style at the turn of the 20th century and feature geometric flowerbeds, a lily pond with a statue of Mercury, and ceremonial stairways leading to pergolas.
name: Italian Gardens
address: 47-49 Esplanade, Scarborough, YO11 2UZ, United Kingdom

detail_description: Scarborough Beach is a popular destination known for its fine, sandy seafront that extends from Scarborough Spa to the Grand Hotel Scarborough. Families often gather here when the North Sea waters recede during low tide. The beach park features two play areas, Railway Place and Pirate Place, as well as a Cotton Tree Forest with climbing opportunities for kids. Additionally, Scarborough's South Bay offers a variety of attractions such as arcades, sailboat rides, and renowned fish and chips from Harry Ramsdens.
name: Scarborough Beach
address: Scarborough, YO11 2QE, United Kingdom

detail_description: North Bay Beach is a serene and scenic spot located on the quieter side of Scarborough. Accessible by public transit or a leisurely walk along Marine Parade, it offers sandy shores, ideal for swimming and sunbathing, as well as breathtaking views of the North Sea. The beach is popular among surfers and windsurfers due to its favorable conditions. With Blue Flag status, it's perfect for families seeking a traditional seaside experience away from the bustling tourist areas.
name: North Bay Beach
address: 7HWR+3R, Scarborough, YO12 7TN, United Kingdom

detail_description: Scarborough Market Hall and Vaults, a historic building dating back to 1853, is a bustling shopping center located in St. Helens Square. Before its construction, weekly markets were scattered across different parts of Scarborough, each specializing in specific commodities. The market now features three floors with traditional stalls offering fresh produce, local goods, and a variety of shops. Additionally, visitors can explore gift shops selling locally made beach-themed gifts and artisan crafts on the balcony area.
name: Scarborough Market Hall and Vaults
address: St Helen's Square, Scarborough, YO11 1EU, United Kingdom

excerpt: This waterpark boasts 4 slides, a wave pool and an eatery, plus a spa with a sauna and steam.
detail_description: Alpamare UK is a great place for families to have lots of fun. It has four slides, a wave pool, and an eatery. Plus, the spa has a sauna and steam room.
name: Alpamare UK
address: 28 Burniston Rd, Scarborough, YO12 6PH, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Cleveland Way is a stunning 109-mile trail that begins in the charming town of Helmsley and stretches all the way to Filey, showcasing the breathtaking landscapes of North York Moors and dramatic coastal views. This remarkable path takes you along some of England's highest cliffs, leading you down into hidden coves and picturesque fishing villages.
name: Cleveland Way
address: Scarborough, YO13 0DA, United Kingdom

name: Alpamare Car Park
address: Burniston Rd, Scarborough, YO12 6PH, United Kingdom

detail_description: If you find yourself wandering the picturesque Scarborough seafront, make sure to stop by Papa's Fish & Chips for a delightful culinary experience. This popular takeaway spot is renowned for its fresh and traditional fish and chips, which can be enjoyed either on-site or taken away to savor while soaking in the coastal views. Diners consistently praise the generous portions, perfectly crispy batter, and the warm hospitality of the staff who strive to ensure every visit is memorable.
name: Papa's Fish & Chips Scarborough Seafront Takeaway
address: 22 Foreshore Rd, Scarborough, YO11 1PB, United Kingdom

excerpt: Modest funfair featuring rides for children & adults, plus snacks & arcade games.
detail_description: Nestled at the northern end of South Bay, near Scarborough Harbour, Luna Park Scarborough is a delightful family-friendly amusement park that promises a day filled with joy and excitement. This charming funfair features an array of rides suitable for both children and adults, ensuring everyone finds something to enjoy.
name: Luna Park
address: Sandside, Scarborough, YO11 1PG, United Kingdom

excerpt: Hillside 1km race track for cars and motorbikes, with a shorter sprint course for bikes only.
detail_description: Oliver's Mount Racing is a unique 1km race track for cars and motorbikes, with an additional shorter sprint course exclusively for bikes. Situated on high ground overlooking Scarborough, North Yorkshire, England, it offers stunning views over the town and features a monument to the war dead. The area also provides camping spots at selected times of the year and sports facilities including 10 football pitches and 1 rugby league pitch.
name: Oliver's Mount Racing
address: The Circuit Office, Oliver's Mount, Scarborough YO11 2YW, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Scarborough Maritime Heritage Centre, located near the lively South Bay, offers a compact yet comprehensive insight into Scarborough's rich maritime legacy. The museum is a valuable resource for researchers with its extensive records and captivating exhibits. One highlight is the display showcasing traditional knitted garments crafted for sailors, including the renowned 'Scarborough' pattern gansey. Additionally, visitors can explore the recently renovated South Bay Market Vaults, an indoor market brimming with unique treasures.
name: Scarborough Maritime Heritage Centre
address: 45 Eastborough, Scarborough, YO11 1NH, United Kingdom

detail_description: Harbour Bar Ltd, located at 1-3 Sandside on South Bay beach in Scarborough, is a renowned ice cream parlour that has been serving its delicious treats since August 1945. The Alonzi family, originally from Rome, has been crafting their own ice cream for generations. The retro 1950s milk bar style of the cafe has remained unchanged over the decades and is considered an iconic part of Scarborough's history.
name: Harbour Bar Ltd
address: 1-3 Sandside, Scarborough, YO11 1PE, United Kingdom

name: Hispaniola Pirate Ship
address: Sandside, Scarborough, YO11 1PE, United Kingdom

excerpt: Stalwart cinema screening a weekly programme of Hollywood blockbusters and newly released films.
detail_description: Hollywood Plaza Cinema is a classic movie theater that offers a weekly lineup of popular Hollywood blockbusters and newly released films. Despite having only one screen, the cinema provides a quaint and charming atmosphere, making it an ideal place to spend time while waiting for the rain to pass. Although currently closed due to UK restrictions, visitors can look forward to its reopening dates. Additionally, the nearby Beaches Bed & Breakfast Scarborough provides convenient access to this cinema.
name: Hollywood Plaza Cinema
address: 159 N Marine Rd, Scarborough, YO12 7HU, United Kingdom

detail_description: Embark on an exhilarating adventure at the Scarborough Sky Trail Adventure, offering breathtaking coastal views and excitement for both kids and adults. This thrilling course features a 2-level rope bridge and a series of beams, perfect for conquering fears while enjoying the heights. Despite being caught in a downpour, the trail remained safe to navigate with friendly staff providing assistance when needed.
name: Scarborough Sky Trail Adventure
address: North Bay Railway, Burniston Rd, Scarborough YO12 6PF, United Kingdom

detail_description: Hairy Bob's Cave, located along Scarborough's Marine Drive, is a mysterious natural formation with a quirky name. The cave features a window and door carved into a large boulder, its origins shrouded in mystery dating back to 1919. Some speculate it may have been part of the construction of Marine Drive. Despite its enigmatic history, Hairy Bob's Cave offers an intriguing photo opportunity for visitors exploring the area.
name: Hairy Bob's Cave
address: 7JQ5+RX, Scarborough, YO11 1HY, United Kingdom

detail_description: Royal Albert Park, formerly known as a different name, offers stunning views of North Bay and features charming coastal walks and natural areas. The park is currently undergoing improvements including a new play area, extended skateboard park, viewpoints, and picnic areas. It provides three picnic tables with ample space in between and free restroom facilities. Although parking requires payment, the park's accessibility to the beach makes it worth it. Visitors can enjoy wheelchair-friendly paths with breathtaking vistas over North Bay and beyond.
name: Royal Albert Park
address: Unnamed Road, Scarborough, YO11 1RD, United Kingdom

detail_description: Cayton Bay is a superb beach that attracts surfers, walkers, and fossil hunters due to its natural geology. It offers good parking and is surrounded by shops, making it convenient for visitors. The beach is accessible through different routes, one of which involves a steep path. Despite being somewhat challenging to reach, the area is beautiful and worth the visit. Visitors can enjoy walking through the woods to access the clean waters and pristine beach.
name: Cayton Bay
address: Osgodby Hill, Scarborough, YO11 3NP, United Kingdom

name: The Secret Garden Manor Road Cemetery
address: Manor Rd, Scarborough, YO12 7RT, United Kingdom

detail_description: Hairy Bob's Skatepark, located on Marine Drive, is a popular spot for children aged 4-16 to practice skateboarding and scootering. The park offers a variety of ramps suitable for different skill levels, making it an ideal place for kids to learn new tricks. Additionally, there is ample parking available along Marine Drive, allowing parents to supervise their children from a comfortable distance. Visitors also appreciate the scenic sea views from the park's location right on the coast.
name: Hairy Bob's Skatepark
address: Marine Dr, Scarborough, YO11 1HY, United Kingdom

detail_description: Shuttleworth Gardens is a charming and tranquil garden located at the far south end of the promenade in Scarborough. Despite its small size, it offers a delightful escape from the bustling Esplanade, with ornamental borders and a well-maintained miniature village that evokes nostalgic memories. The garden is well-kept and provides plenty of benches for visitors to relax and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.
name: Shuttleworth Gardens
address: Scarborough, YO11 2UE, United Kingdom

detail_description: Located in an industrial estate on the outskirts of town, Scarborough Brewery is a small, family-owned brewery that has been operating since 2009. Despite its off-the-beaten-track location, it has gained popularity for its special events and wide range of beers. Starting as a one barrel brew pub, it has now expanded to a 10 barrel plant, producing delicious pale and golden ales, IPAs, and rich porters.
name: Scarborough Brewery
address: Unit 21B, Barry's Ln, Scarborough YO12 4HA, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Black Lion in Scarborough offers a cozy pub accommodation with a friendly bar and shared lounge, along with free WiFi throughout the property. The hotel features family rooms, each equipped with a shared bathroom featuring a powerful shower. Despite some noise disturbances from neighboring guests, the clean rooms are well-maintained and come with personal wash basins and tea/coffee making facilities.
name: Black Lion
address: North St, Scarborough, YO11 1DF, United Kingdom

detail_description: Castle Tavern is a 12th-century castle situated between North and South Bay in Scarborough, offering stunning views of the town. Despite enduring five sieges and being left in ruins during the English Civil War, it remains a popular attraction. Visitors can enjoy impressive vistas while savoring a delicious Sunday roast dinner at affordable prices. The tavern also provides a lively atmosphere with karaoke and friendly staff, making it a memorable experience for all patrons.
name: Castle Tavern
address: 49 Castle Rd, Scarborough, YO11 1BG, United Kingdom

detail_description: Cafe View is a charming family-run cafe that offers fantastic views of the harbor, beach, and sea. It's a favorite spot among locals and visitors alike, offering a welcoming staff and a menu filled with delicious treats. The cafe is known for its homemade afternoon teas with hearty portions, including sandwiches, chutneys, mixed fruits, and beautifully crafted desserts.
name: Cafe View
address: Town Centre, 57 Eastborough, Scarborough YO11 1NH, United Kingdom

excerpt: Simple venue with a nostalgic vibe preparing seafood classics sourced from the nearby fish market.
detail_description: Winking Willy's Famous Fish & Chip Shop & Cafe is a charming and nostalgic venue located along the South Bay seafront in Scarborough. The restaurant offers stunning harbor views, and patrons have the option to dine in or take their meals for a seaside picnic on the beach. Known for sourcing its seafood directly from the nearby fish market, Winking Willy's ensures freshness and quality in their dishes.
name: Winking Willy's Famous Fish & Chip Shop & Cafe
address: 9-10 Sandside, Scarborough, YO11 1PE, United Kingdom

detail_description: The South Cliff Clock Tower is a significant feature in Scarborough, situated at the entrance of the South Cliff Gardens. Constructed to honor the coronation of King George V in 1911, it stands on a picturesque viewpoint. The design draws inspiration from Christopher Wren's English Baroque monuments and showcases a lantern and weather vane atop four clock faces framed by Ionic columns and pediments. Up until the 1960s, this clock required manual winding for operation.
name: South Cliff Clock Tower
address: Esplanade, Scarborough, YO11 2XA, UK

excerpt: Classic Victoriana and steam-powered fairground rides in a venue exhibiting a private collection.
detail_description: Nestled within the Flower of May Holiday Park, the Scarborough Fair Collection & Vintage Transport Museum is a treasure trove for those who adore classic fairground nostalgia. This charming venue showcases an impressive array of vintage rides, including beautifully restored carousels and dodgems that transport visitors back to simpler times. The highlight for many is the enchanting mechanical organs that fill the air with delightful tunes throughout the day, thanks to a dedicated staff member who ensures they are up and running.
name: Scarborough Fair Collection & Vintage Transport Museum
address: Flower of May Holiday Park, Stone Pit Lane, Scarborough YO11 3NU, United Kingdom

detail_description: Cayton Bay Beach is a picturesque and serene destination, distinct from other crowded beaches in the area. Unlike typical touristy spots, it offers a peaceful atmosphere with minimal commercialization. The beach is popular among surfers due to its natural geology and also attracts walkers and fossil enthusiasts. Visitors can enjoy the clean sand and sea without being overwhelmed by shops or arcades. While there's only one shop for essentials at the cliff top, it's advisable to come prepared for a relaxing day out.
name: Cayton Bay Beach
address: Cayton, Scarborough, YO11 3NR, United Kingdom

name: "Freddie Gilroy" Sculpture by Ray Lonsdale
address: 10 Royal Albert Dr, Scarborough, YO12 7TY, United Kingdom

excerpt: Aquatic recreation area with inflatable structures, a cafe & kayaking & stand-up paddleboarding.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of North Yorkshire, the North Yorkshire Water Park is a fantastic destination for families and adventure seekers alike. This expansive aquatic recreation area boasts an impressive array of inflatable structures that promise hours of fun on the water. Visitors can dive into activities like kayaking, stand-up paddleboarding, sailing, and open water swimming. For those who prefer to stay dry while enjoying nature, there’s a scenic 2.
name: North Yorkshire Water Park
address: Long Causeway Rd, Wykeham, Lakes YO13 9QU, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Cinder Track is a 21-mile route that follows the old railway line between Whitby and Scarborough, offering a flat terrain that's perfect for walking and cycling. Along the way, you'll pass through picturesque spots like Hayburn Wyke, Ravenscar, and Robin Hood's Bay. The track provides plenty of opportunities to stop for refreshments or bring your own snacks for a budget-friendly day out.
name: Cinder Track
address: Old Scarborough to Whitby Railway (Cinder Track), Scarborough, YO12 5ER, United Kingdom

excerpt: State-of-the-art casino for table gaming with a global food menu until 2am every night of the week.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Scarborough, the Opera House Casino is a modern gem that has been captivating visitors since its grand opening in late 2005. With an impressive investment of around £7 million, this state-of-the-art venue offers a vibrant atmosphere for gaming enthusiasts. Guests can indulge in a variety of table games like blackjack, baccarat, and poker—both Caribbean Stud and Texas Hold'em—available until the early hours.
name: Opera House Casino
address: 56-64 St Thomas St, Scarborough, YO11 1DU, United Kingdom

detail_description: Tracy Savage Fine Art Gallery is a popular attraction in downtown Scarborough, offering stunning artwork inspired by the local area. The gallery features limited edition canvases and prints that capture the essence of Scarborough and Whitby. Visitors can expect a warm welcome from friendly staff who are passionate about Tracy Savage's work. The gallery is a joy to browse, with many visitors leaving with their own piece of art to bring a touch of Scarborough into their homes.
name: Tracy Savage
address: times will, 18 St Nicholas Cliff, Scarborough vary, please call the gallery before planning a trip, Opening YO11 2ES, United Kingdom

excerpt: Community-focused nonprofit established in 1844 with recreational programs & services for all ages.
detail_description: The YMCA Theatre is a community-focused nonprofit theater with high quality amateur productions. The theater is well maintained and has a seating space of 290. It also has fully equipped back stage facilities for the actors. The venue is great for shows and the prices of ice creams are not too bad, but some families do not like the prices of tickets.
name: YMCA Theatre
address: St Thomas St, Scarborough, YO11 1DY, United Kingdom

detail_description: St Martin-on-the-Hill in Scarborough is a hidden gem with stunning stained glass windows designed by renowned artists such as William Morris, Sir Edward Burne-Jones, and Dante Gabriel Rosetti. The church also houses a charming community cafe called Beggars Retreat that offers homemade food and cakes. Visitors can enjoy the historical significance of the church while indulging in delicious meals and experiencing a warm and welcoming atmosphere.
name: Beggars Belief Cafe
address: The Church of St Martin-on-the-Hill, Albion Rd, Scarborough YO11 2BT, United Kingdom
